  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15991].
  {panel}

I've customised ConfluenceActionSupport.properties to replace the confluence expressions with terms that I expect to be more familiar to my target audience, who are very non-geek.  I suspect this is not an uncommon activity.

It was actually a bit tricky, because I couldn't just search and replace, because the terms I wanted to change are used in different ways, only some of which I wanted to change.

For example, sometimes Confluence is used to mean "this website", and sometimes it is used to mean "the software".

Where it was used to mean the website, I've tried to change it.  Where it is used to mean the software, I've tried not to change it.

"Page" also has multiple meanings.  Sometimes it means any confluence page, including blogposts.  Sometimes it means a confluence page, excluding blogposts.  Sometimes it means any web page, confluence or not.

And of course, I had to be careful only to change to the right of each "=" sign.

It would have been much easier to make the changes I wanted if, at the top of ConfluenceActionSupport.properties, there had been a block that said 

confluence_software=Confluence
confluence_site=Confluence
confluence_space=space
confluence_regular_page=page
confluence_any_page=page
confluence_blogpost=blogpost
confluence_dashboard=...

And them, if references to page were qualified as ${confluence_regular_page}, or some such.

It would mean that I would only have to make the changes I want in a few places, and better still, it would mean that I wouldn't have to work out which ones to change and which ones to leave.
fields.summary: Support macros inside ConfluenceActionSupport.properties to simplify customising and maintaining.

fields.description:
According to jQuery documentation http://docs.jquery.com/Utilities/jQuery.extend#deeptargetobject1objectN, the target object of the extend method should come before source objects.
However in macro-browser.js:
            var selectedParams = t.selectedMacro ? $.extend(t.selectedMacro.params, {}) : {}; // make a copy
The target and the source are swapped.
It should be:
            var selectedParams = t.selectedMacro ? $.extend({}, t.selectedMacro.params) : {}; // make a copy

This bug causes a problem if the macro being edited has parameters unknown to macro browser. The effect is that these parameters are not passed to the preview iframe.
fields.summary: Parameters passed to jQuery extend method are in wrong order

fields.description:
The new biggest source of log errors as at 28/05/09 is com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.DefaultI18NBean's getText(String key, Object[] args) method:

{code}
230 ERROR [confluence.util.i18n.I18NBean.getText] Error formatting internationalized string with key: 
    This is the {gliffy} macro which converts Gliffy Attachments to images you can see on a page
230 ERROR [confluence.util.i18n.I18NBean.getText] Error formatting internationalized string with key: 
    Required. The {mockup} macro displays the ui mockup in the page.
{code}

The URL for these errors is {{/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action}} so it looks like a problem with the Jsonation of the macro's description Message object. Namely, that getText(Message message) in DefaultI18NBean delegates to getText(String key, Object[] args) with the message arguments which calls {{java.text.MessageFormat.format(result, args)}} even if the args == null. As the message text contains a placeholder {glffy} or {mockup} an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Couldn't the MessageFormat.format call be skipped if the Message args are null or an empty array? Even if the message text _could_ be parsed by MessageFormat the placeholder substitutions wouldn't do anything.
fields.summary: I18NBean getText method spamming EAC logs

fields.description:
This is a development task which should involve George, Giles and maybe IT. It must be driven by a developer, don't make Giles do this on his own.

Some bulletpointed ideas for best practices:

* upgrade and reindex one cluster at a time, shut down again. this avoids cluster communication during reindex
* lock out users from a server that is reindexing after an upgrade. this helps reindexing be fast
* try reindexing out on staging server. if the time it takes feels long compared the size of the installation, or if it takes longer than 30 minutes, investigate: reindexing should max out all cores. the more you cores you have, the faster reindexing should be. if the cores are not maxed out, check other parameters like disk IO, database, etc. It could be that your 8 cores can't work fast enought because your database is on a slow (or saturared) network link, or generally much weaker hardware.

* Possibly try concmarksweep. We have made good experiences with xxxxx. we wouldnt set this as the default setting, because all jvms are different. 

See Paul for some examples on trying this on QA-CAC.
fields.summary: Improve upgrade guide with some performance tips

fields.description:
At some point, while our instance was running for more than 3 weeks, the index does not seem to update itself anymore.
The Recently Updated view is not being updated. The search doesn't find new or changed pages.

As this problem gives the impression the wiki is not being used and rendering the search being defective I rate this issue critical. 

As our workaround, we restarted the instanced and clicked manually update in the system administration panel. Afterwards, it worked again.. for about 4 weeks ... :( 

Has anybody noticed the same problem and has more information about it?
fields.summary: Index does not seem to update itself anymore

fields.description:
Discovered during user sessions...

Users don't know what a "widget connector" would do. But the macro itself provides many options that business users _would_ find useful. So it needs aliases.

Create multiple aliases for the Widget Connector in the interface with different descriptions. Split it out into a "Video Connector", "Widget Connector", "Document Connector", etc. Create a separate category called "Connectors" to house them.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15907].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Current implementation of columns is unusable. It unintuitively requires a "Section" macro to wrap around it. Users also find it strange that making multiple columns requires multiple column macros, not a single "Column Layout" macro.

No user in any of my user sessions has been able to create columns in the RTE.

h3. Solution

Quick fixes for the Macro Browser...

- Add text into the "Column" macro description detailing that it requires the "Section" macro to wrap around it.
- Ask Giles to further explicate this fact in the linked Documentation (with a more obvious Note macro at the top, possibly). 

Proper fix...

Implement something similar to Dashboard's current layout implementation.
fields.summary: Macro Browser - Current column implementation is unusable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15903].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Users aren't provided with any initial default HTML for the title page, header and footer. This can make it impossible for those who don't know these syntaxes.

h3. Solution

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-837 - contains design and also information about getting the Design team to do this work.

Provide default HTML title page that uses a space icon, name and description. Headers and footers use copyright information and add page numbers.

Additional work: Provide highlighting for entries that aren't part of the HTML syntax (i.e. title text, body text, etc).
fields.summary: Space Admin - PDF Stylesheet Page has no default values

fields.description:
h3. Problems

PDF Stylesheet page has no reference to the fact that the Title, Header and Footer sections require HTML coding. This is not at all obvious in the interface and means that when users come to this page they will often not know what to do.

Less severe problems include: location of the button has potential to be confusing, layout could also be improved, link to PDF Export page could be useful.

h3. Solution

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-837

That ticket contains screens to show how the layout should be adjusted. It includes putting the CSS stylesheet section into a separate part of the navigation.

Please contact me if the design requires further iterations.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15892].
  {panel}

A large amount of work has been done updating documentation for bundled macros in Confluence 3.0. This raises the problem that the bundled macro notation help will be less polished or even inaccurate.

This issue includes the use of aliases in the Macro Browser, where a macro opened with one name (e.g. 'nl') will be saved as another ('nolink'), or where an old "uber" macro name like 'viewfile' is directed to a more specific macro like 'viewdoc'.

As the Macro Browser links directly to the CAC docs it makes sense for CAC to be the "source of truth" and for the notation guide to follow. We need to find a way to do this without merely replicating the CAC text (and its i18ns).

In the short term, we could simply point users to the Macro Browser or CAC for problem notation guide entries.
fields.summary: Notation help for bundled macros duplicates or is out of date compared to CAC docs

fields.description:
The paper size for PDF exports in Confluence 2.10.x and previous versions was A4 (210mm x 297mm).

However, with the new PDF export feature, the default for Confluence 3.0 has changed to US Letter size.

While it is now easier to change page sizes for PDF exports, this still represents a departure from the product's previous behaviour and so for this case, we should probably stick to the way things were done.
fields.summary: PDF Exports is no longer using A4 as the default page size.

fields.description:
In the Rich Text editor is has problems changing lines of text into code and preformatted sections.

The lines are lost and 1 big single line is put in the code section.  It only seems to happen when you have cerate a fresh code section without any lines in it already.

Steps to reproduce:

1.  Type some lines of text into the RTE (Typically this a a copy of past of some other line data)
2. Now select the text and apply code/preformatted to it


Now the text is one big long line and is readable only to lexical analysers!
fields.summary: RTE - Paste into a code block lose the line orientation
